thread.title: Lord Warner: Labour 'hasn't a hope in hell' under Corbyn
thread.title_full: Lord Warner: Labour 'hasn't a hope in hell' under Corbyn - BBC News

author: BBC
title: Lord Warner: Labour 'hasn't a hope in hell' under Corbyn
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Lord Warner: Labour 'hasn't a hope in hell' under Corbyn 20 October 2015 Last updated at 09:30 BST
Former Labour Health Minister Lord Warner has resigned the party whip in protest at the party's approach under new leader Jeremy Corbyn.
Speaking on the Today programme he says Labour faces an “existential crisis” and does not have a “hope in hell” of winning an election under its current leadership.
“[Labour] has to understand why a large number of people decided to vote for four other parties on 7 May, it hasn’t done that,” he said.
Read more Warner quits Labour and says party 'hasn't hope in hell'
